FuncDef:
The apply local-preference command sets the local preference (Local-Pref) for BGP routes.
The undo apply local-preference command cancels the configuration. The apply local-preference command sets the local preference (Local-Pref) for BGP routes. The undo apply local-preference command cancels the configuration. By default, for a locally generated route and route learned from an EBGP peer (such routes do not carry the Local-Pref attribute), the device uses 100 as the local preference of those routes during route selection; for a route learned from an IBGP peer (such a route carries the Local-Pref attribute), the device uses the carried Local-Pref attribute value as the local preference of the route.

ParaDef.Info:
Increases the local preference of BGP routes, with the final local preference of a BGP route not greater than 4294967295. If a BGP route does not carry the Local-Pref attribute, the device uses 0 as the base local preference.
-

Reduces the local preference of BGP routes, with the final local preference of a BGP route not smaller than 0. If a BGP route does not carry the Local-Pref attribute, the device uses 0 as the base local preference. In this case, the local preference of the BGP route is still 0 after the deduction.
-

Specifies the local preference of BGP routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo: The Local-Pref attribute is a proprietary attribute of BGP, used to determine the optimal route when traffic leaves an AS. When a BGP device obtains multiple routes with the same destination address but different next hops through IBGP peers, the route with the largest Local_Pref value is selected. The apply local-preference command sets only the local preference for BGP routes.
